body:
Trying to work on some home security stuff - my plans are simple enough that I think I'll probably manage it too.

I'm really looking for decent stuff to contribute too tho - I feel kinda "*meh*" about a lot of my own ideas. But I'm not really finding anything that appeals to me at the mo.

Trying to work on some home security stuff - my plans are simple enough that I think I'll probably manage it too.

What are y'all working on outside your day jobs? What tech are you using, and how's it going?
post.title: What side projects are you working on?

body:
(released, but needs love) Genetic programming with a twist.  C.

(released, but needs love) A simplified version of the above. Taking the library and applying it to more straightforward problem, and interspersed with explanations and a lot of visual feedback. Because no one understood wtf I was talking about with the above and it wasn't very showy. C. SDL.

(in progress) Bobble-heads for Helltaker. Not really programming, but I'm learning Blender for it. (ugh, and I have to fix the heater on my 3D printer).  Blender.

(storyboarding) A software version of a Firefly board game my friend really loves.   I'm considering just doing it as a set of maptool macros or something. No need to re-invent the wheel.  Maptool or C/SDL, not sure yet.

(various states of half-finished) Way too many half-finished 7DRL games.   Biggest one is probably a pokemon-roguelike mashup. Mostly C. Rust, Python, and one that barely got past "hello world" in Haskell. I use these to learn new languages and libraries.

(half-finished) A library of handy tools for dirt-simple cryptography. Like, ceasers-cypher and such.   But animated so kids can use it and figure out what's actually going on in the background. C++.  Fucking openGL though. 

(storyboarding) A presentation/chat program where the chatters can promote representatives, petition for questions to be pushed forward to the presentor, cite items in the transcript or cite things arguing against what was presented.   A tool to have better debates.  One that wrangles the masses and keeps it from being a chaotic mess of noise, but lets everyone have a voice and organize themselves into something bigger.  Webdev would have to be javascript. But fuck javascript. I've been toying with Emscripten, a C->Javascript compiler.
body_html:
(released, but needs love) Genetic programming with a twist. C.

(released, but needs love) A simplified version of the above. Taking the library and applying it to more straightforward problem, and interspersed with explanations and a lot of visual feedback. Because no one understood wtf I was talking about with the above and it wasn't very showy. C. SDL.

(in progress) Bobble-heads for Helltaker. Not really programming, but I'm learning Blender for it. (ugh, and I have to fix the heater on my 3D printer). Blender.

(storyboarding) A software version of a Firefly board game my friend really loves. I'm considering just doing it as a set of maptool macros or something. No need to re-invent the wheel. Maptool or C/SDL, not sure yet.

(various states of half-finished) Way too many half-finished 7DRL games. Biggest one is probably a pokemon-roguelike mashup. Mostly C. Rust, Python, and one that barely got past "hello world" in Haskell. I use these to learn new languages and libraries.

(half-finished) A library of handy tools for dirt-simple cryptography. Like, ceasers-cypher and such. But animated so kids can use it and figure out what's actually going on in the background. C++. Fucking openGL though.

(storyboarding) A presentation/chat program where the chatters can promote representatives, petition for questions to be pushed forward to the presentor, cite items in the transcript or cite things arguing against what was presented. A tool to have better debates. One that wrangles the masses and keeps it from being a chaotic mess of noise, but lets everyone have a voice and organize themselves into something bigger. Webdev would have to be javascript. But fuck javascript. I've been toying with Emscripten, a C->Javascript compiler.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
None, because I just quit because I suck and can't ever do anything right.

I'm quitting this along with everything else I do too, because there's not one thing in life I don't suck at so much that I can't get anything accomplished. I don't think anything will ever change that. Thankfully there is one thing I'm decent at that I'm not giving up on, but it's not something I can really occupy myself with all the time, and it won't last for much longer. And it also doesn't relate to projects or making things. So I guess idk what to do with my time now. Maybe I'll try to be more social or explore different places more or something, to find something to do, I don't really know.
body_html:
None, because I just quit because I suck and can't ever do anything right.

I'm quitting this along with everything else I do too, because there's not one thing in life I don't suck at so much that I can't get anything accomplished. I don't think anything will ever change that. Thankfully there is one thing I'm decent at that I'm not giving up on, but it's not something I can really occupy myself with all the time, and it won't last for much longer. And it also doesn't relate to projects or making things. So I guess idk what to do with my time now. Maybe I'll try to be more social or explore different places more or something, to find something to do, I don't really know.
